scenes.audio: Subtitles available!
scenes.visuals: Title card with text "Subtitles available!" and "Subtítulos disponibles!" in large yellow font. Below are flags (UK, Portugal, Spain, France, Italy, Germany) and a screenshot showing how to turn on YouTube subtitles, highlighting the Neolatin option (labeled "Latin").

scenes.audio: Subtítulos disponibles!
scenes.visuals: Same title card as the previous scene, focusing on the Spanish text and subtitle instructions for Neolatin ("Select Latin").

scenes.audio: El Interlingua, una lengua panrománica?
scenes.visuals: Animated diagram. Flags of several Romance languages (Romanian, French, Spanish, Portuguese, Italian, possibly another Romanian/Catalan flag) point with red arrows towards a central flag (blue top, red bottom, white four-pointed star in the middle - the Interlingua flag). A thinking emoji and a large black question mark appear next to the diagram on a light grey background. The audio speaker is asking if Interlingua is a pan-Romance language in Neolatino language, not Spanish or English

scenes.audio: Non!
scenes.visuals: A large, bold red X appears centrally on a slightly blurred, colorful background. Below the X, the word "NON!" is written in bold red font with a black outline. The audio speaker negates the previous question

scenes.audio: È possibile che àbbias audito parlare de una lengua clamata
scenes.visuals: A man with long, dark, wavy hair, a beard, and wearing a grey t-shirt speaks directly to the camera against a green screen background. He is holding a small black lavalier microphone clip near his mouth. He talks about possibly having heard of a language called Interlingua. The language spoken is Interlingua

scenes.audio: interlingua.
scenes.visuals: The Interlingua flag (blue top, red bottom, white four-pointed star) is displayed centrally on a light grey background. Below it, the text "Interlingua (IALA)" appears in bold black font. The audio speaker names the language

scenes.audio: Artìculos, commentarios de vìdeos in lìnea
scenes.visuals: The man from the previous green screen scene resumes speaking, mentioning articles and online video comments

scenes.audio: sopre questa incredìbile lengua que connecta fàcilemente las lenguas romànicas.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in front of the green screen. He gestures with his hands while discussing the language connecting Romance languages easily

scenes.audio: Que plus se pote pèrder?
scenes.visuals: The man, still against the green screen, raises his hands in a questioning gesture while speaking

scenes.audio: Bene, cuesto non è toto.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in front of the green screen, stating that this isn't all

scenes.audio: Plus specificamente, pare que ìa una mala comprensione de lo que realmente è lo interlingua.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks against the green screen, holding the microphone clip. He explains there seems to be a misunderstanding about what Interlingua truly is

scenes.audio: Allora, que è veramente lo interlingua?
scenes.visuals: A bright yellow background appears with large black text centered: "QUE ÈST VERAMENTE LO INTERLINGUA?". The audio asks what Interlingua really is

scenes.audio: Lo interlingua è una lengua auxiliàre internationale desveloppata per la American International Auxiliary Language Association o IALA
scenes.visuals: The man is back in front of the green screen, speaking and holding the microphone. He defines Interlingua as an international auxiliary language developed by the IALA

scenes.audio: basata sopre las lenguas europeas populares atravèrs de los lor ràdices grecas e latinas compartitas e, in menore mesura, orìgines indoeuropeos.
scenes.visuals: An image of the cover page of the "Interlingua-English: a dictionary of the international language" prepared by the IALA under Alexander Gode is shown on the left side of a light purple background. On the right, quotes from the dictionary are displayed, highlighting "Greco-Latin", "Anglo-Romance group", "German", "Russian", and "Indo-European". The audio explains Interlingua's basis in European languages via shared roots

scenes.audio: Fu creato por èssere una lengua planificata artificiale que se assemblasse a las lenguas naturales, rendèndo la fàcilemente comprensìbile a prima vista.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks against the green screen. Animated cartoon eyes briefly pop up over his face as he mentions easy comprehension at first sight

scenes.audio: Cuesto è in contrasto con una lengua semelante, lo esperanto,
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking, contrasting Interlingua with a similar language, Esperanto

scenes.audio: Esperanto
scenes.visuals: The Esperanto flag (green field with a white canton containing a green star) is displayed on a light beige background with the word "Esperanto" below it

scenes.audio: que fu creato por èssere una lengua fàcile de aprèndere, ma a lo costo de la intelligibilitate instantànea.
scenes.visuals: The man resumes speaking in front of the green screen, explaining Esperanto's goal of being easy to learn versus Interlingua's goal of immediate intelligibility

scenes.audio: De plus, lo que distingue lo interlingua de lo esperanto fu una methodología scientifica que determinau so desveloppamento.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking against the green screen, highlighting the scientific methodology behind Interlingua's development as a key difference from Esperanto

scenes.audio: La IALA usau quattro lenguas principales de contròllo por determinare so vocabulario e grammàtica.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks against the green screen, holding up four fingers briefly while mentioning the four primary control languages used by IALA

scenes.audio: 4 (QUATTRO) LENGUAS DE CONTRÒLLO
scenes.visuals: White background with centered black text: "4 (QUATTRO) LENGUAS DE CONTRÒLLO"

scenes.audio: Lo francese, lo italiano, lo espannîòlo e lo portughese, tractatos como una sola unitate devuto a lor similitudes, e, finalmente, lo anglese.
scenes.visuals: Animation on a light grey background shows flags representing the control languages appearing sequentially with their names below: French flag ("FRANCESE"), Italian flag ("ITALIANO"), Spanish and Portuguese flags bracketed together as one unit ("ESPANNÎÒLO / PORTUGHESE", "1 (UNA) UNITATE"), and the British flag ("ANGLESE"). The audio lists these primary control languages

scenes.audio: In menore mesura, la IALA tambèn ne consultau las lenguas secundarias de contròllo:
scenes.visuals: The man resumes speaking in front of the green screen, mentioning secondary control languages

scenes.audio: lo alemanno e lo russo.
scenes.visuals: A dark grey background appears with centered black text: "2 (DOAS) LENGUAS SECUNDARIAS DE CONTRÒLLO". Below, the German flag appears ("ALEMANNO"), followed by the Russian flag ("RUSSO"). The audio names these secondary languages

scenes.audio: Secundo so principio de internationalitate, lo alemanno o lo russo se poterìan substituere por una lengua principale.
scenes.visuals: Animation on a grey background. The six control language flags (French, Italian, Spanish/Portuguese, English, German, Russian) are shown. Red arrows indicate German can swap with Italian. The German flag moves up to replace the Italian flag in the top row of primary languages, while the Italian flag moves down to the secondary row

scenes.audio: Allora, ja vedemos que varias lenguas non romànicas an influentiato lo interlingua, perque lo interlingua fu conceputo por la communicatione internationale generale.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks against the green screen, explaining that non-Romance languages influenced Interlingua because it was designed for general international communication

scenes.audio: Nonostante, sen entrare troppo in detàllies, la majore parte de lo vocabulario, malgrado la influèntia de lenguas non romànicas como lo anglese, terminau proveniendo de lo latino clàssico e de lenguas romànicas.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking against the green screen, explaining that despite influences like English, most Interlingua vocabulary comes from Classical Latin and Romance languages

scenes.audio: Questa distintione è importante, perque las lenguas romànicas son lenguas derivatas de lo latino, soffrendo evolutiones ùnicas tanto in lor vocabulario quanto lor grammàtica.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking, emphasizing the importance of the Romance languages being derived from Latin and having unique evolutions

scenes.audio: Las lenguas romànicas frequentemente an paràulas clamatas dobletos, onde a vèces una paràula se hereditau e la altra paràula, con la mesma orìgine, fu presa directamente de lo latino clàssico.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking in front of the green screen, explaining the concept of doublets in Romance languages (inherited vs. directly borrowed words)

scenes.audio: Por fàcere un exèmplo, lo espannîòlo a la paràula hereditata "delgado" e lo prèstito latino "delicado", cada uno con lo pròprio significato.
scenes.visuals: A comparison graphic appears on a light grey background. Title: "Latino: delicātus.". Left side shows the Spanish flag, the word "Delgado" (highlighted red), "(Paraula hereditata)", the UK flag, and "Slim, Thin". Right side shows the Spanish flag, the word "Delicado" (highlighted red), "(Prèstito)", the UK flag, and "Delicate". The audio provides this example of a doublet in Spanish derived from Latin

scenes.audio: Nonostante, quando se tracta de la grammàtica de lo interlingua, la història è molto differente.
scenes.visuals: The man resumes speaking against the green screen, stating that Interlingua's grammar is very different

scenes.audio: La methodología era tale que si estava absente una sola characterìstica grammaticale, la excluderon.
scenes.visuals: Animation showing the Interlingua flag and the four primary control language flags (French, Italian, Spanish/Portuguese, English). Green checkmarks appear under French, Italian, and Spanish/Portuguese, but a red X appears under English. A larger red X then covers the Interlingua flag, indicating a feature exclusion based on the methodology

scenes.audio: Permìtte me èssere claro: la grammàtica non fu determinata per las characterìsticas de la majorìa, ma plus tosto per lo denominatore comune de las characterìsticas compartitas per totas las lenguas.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks against the green screen, clarifying that Interlingua's grammar wasn't based on majority features but on the common denominator shared by all control languages

scenes.audio: Como resultato, lo interlingua aripau ad avére una grammàtica europee mèdie standarde, o, in altras paràulas, una grammàtica que se assemblava a las characterìsticas de base de las principales lenguas europeas.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking against the green screen, explaining that Interlingua ended up with a Standard Average European grammar

scenes.audio: De facto, uno de los creatores de lo interlingua, Alexander Gode, avéva descrito la grammàtica de lo interlingua assì:
scenes.visuals: On the left, the cover of "Manifesto de Interlingua" by Alexander Gode (published by Union Mundial pro Interlingua) is shown on a blue background. On the right, a quote appears: "Le plus efficace maniera de formular iste conception ha essite, usque nunc, le tentativa de identificar interlingua con lo que le philologo american Benjamin Lee Whorf ha appellate le europeo medie standard (Standard Average European)." -Manifesto de Interlingua. The text "Standard Average European" is highlighted in yellow. The audio attributes this description to Gode

scenes.audio: Sobretoto la grammàtica de lo interlingua fu enormemente simplificata in comparatione con la grammàtica de las lenguas romànicas, a causa de la influèntia de lo anglese.
scenes.visuals: The man resumes speaking in front of the green screen, stating Interlingua's grammar is greatly simplified compared to Romance languages due to English influence

scenes.audio: Plus sopre cuesto plus tarde...
scenes.visuals: Black screen with centered white text: "Plus sopre cuesto plus tarde..."

scenes.audio: LO OBJECTÌVO
scenes.visuals: Bright yellow background with large black text "LO OBJECTÌVO" centered above a red and white target symbol with a blue arrow hitting the bullseye

scenes.audio: Acora, comparemos lo interlingua con altro projecto:
scenes.visuals: The man resumes speaking in front of the green screen, introducing a comparison with another project

scenes.audio: lo Romance Neolatino, o, simplemente, lo neolatino.
scenes.visuals: The Romance Neolatino flag (maroon background with a yellow sun/star symbol containing the alphabet in a circle) appears on a light grey background. Text below reads: "ROMANCE NEOLATINO (NEOLATINO)"

scenes.audio: Lo neolatino è una lengua panromànica, una lengua creata specificamente por unire las lenguas romànicas.
scenes.visuals: Animation on a light grey background. Flags of Romance languages (Romanian, French, Spanish, Portuguese, Italian, Catalan/Romanian?) point with red arrows towards the central Romance Neolatino flag

scenes.audio: Cuesto significa que, a differèntia de lenguas como lo interlingua, una lengua internationale generale, lo neolatino facilita la communicatione entre parlantes de solo lenguas romànicas, cene una influèntia significativa per parte de lenguas non romànicas como lo anglese.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks against the green screen, contrasting Neolatino (specifically for Romance speakers) with Interlingua (general international, including non-Romance influence like English)

scenes.audio: Como breve nota, si alcuna vècce as audito parlare de lo interslavo, una lengua por parlantes de lenguas eslavas, lo neolatino è lo mesmo, ma por parlantes de lenguas romànicas.
scenes.visuals: Comparison graphic on a grey background. Top: Interslavic flag (diagonal sections of blue, yellow, white, red) with its name variations, equals sign, text "Por lenguas eslavas", and flags of Slavic nations. Bottom: Romance Neolatino flag, its name, equals sign, text "Por lenguas romànicas", and flags of Romance nations

scenes.audio: De facto, Jan van Steenbergen, uno de los creatores de lo interslavo, incluso assisteu a lo congresso in 2022.
scenes.visuals: Screenshot of a YouTube video page titled "International Congress of Romance Neolatino (CIRN) 2022 - COMPLETE EVENT". The video thumbnail shows Jan van Steenbergen's face in a circle. Below, another screenshot shows a live video feed from the congress with Jordi Cassany

scenes.audio: Allora, lo objectivo de lo interlingua è plus generale, mentre que lo neolatino fu creato solo por parlantes de lenguas romànicas.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks against the green screen, summarizing the objectives: Interlingua is more general, Neolatino is only for Romance speakers

scenes.audio: Como resultato de lo objectivo ùnico de lo neolatino, lo neolatino è molto plus semelante a las lenguas romànicas modernas, mantenendo so caràctere romànico.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking, explaining that Neolatino is much closer to modern Romance languages as a result of its specific goal

scenes.audio: Acora que avemos determinato lo objectivo de cada projecto, comparemos lo vocabulario.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks against the green screen, transitioning to a vocabulary comparison

scenes.audio: LO VOCABULARIO
scenes.visuals: Dark blue background with centered white text "LO VOCABULARIO" above an icon of an open book

scenes.audio: In la majore parte de los casos, tanto lo interlingua quanto lo neolatino an paràulas semelantes.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks against the green screen, stating that Interlingua and Neolatino mostly have similar words

scenes.audio: Nonostante, lor objectivos subjacentes conducen a differèntias notàbiles.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking, explaining that their different objectives lead to notable differences

scenes.audio: In primo loco, lo interlingua include multas paràulas de lo latino clàssico que non se usan de lo toto in las lenguas romànicas, como "igitur" e "sed".
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide on a light grey background. Left side shows Interlingua word "Igitur" with synonyms and Romance/English equivalents. Right side shows Interlingua word "Sed" with synonym and Romance/English equivalents. The audio explains Interlingua uses classical Latin words not common in Romance

scenes.audio: In secundo loco, lo interlingua a altras paràulas de lo latino clàssico, ma se usan de manària differente in comparatione con las lenguas romànicas, como "extra" e "ex". In cuesto caso, cuestas paràulas son prepositiones in vèce de èssere adjectivos, como in las lenguas romànicas.
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide on light grey background. Left: Interlingua preposition "Extra" (example "Extra le casa.", synonym "Foras de") vs. Romance/English equivalents (prepositions/adverbs). Right: Interlingua preposition "Ex" (example "Ex le machina.", synonym "De") vs. Romance/English equivalents (prepositions). Below this, a comparison highlights how Romance languages use "extra" and "ex" primarily as adjectives/prefixes ("O dinheiro extra.", "Minha ex namorada.")

scenes.audio: In tertio loco, lo interlingua a paràulas que, por una ratsone o altra, son differentes de las formas que se encontran in las lenguas romànicas.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks against the green screen, introducing the third vocabulary difference

scenes.audio: Algunos cognatos adoptan lor aspecto de lo latino clàssico, como "inter" in vèce de "entre".
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide on light grey background showing Interlingua preposition "Inter" vs. its Romance/English equivalents ("Entre", "Tra", "Între", "Between, Among")

scenes.audio: De plus, algunas paràulas non se assemblan a las formas presentes in las lenguas romànicas intentionalmente.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking against the green screen, explaining some Interlingua words intentionally differ from Romance forms

scenes.audio: A dìcere, paràulas como "tempore" in vèce de "tèmpo" e "corde" in vèce de "còre".
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide on light grey background. Top left shows Romance/English words for 'time' ("Tempo", "Tiempo", "Temps", "Timp", "Time"). Below, Interlingua word "Tèmpo" is crossed out with a red X, replaced by "Tempore" in green. Top right shows Romance/English words for 'heart' ("Coração", "Corazón", "Cor", "Cœur", "Cuore", "Inima", "Heart"). Below, Interlingua word "Còre" is crossed out, replaced by "Corde" in green

scenes.audio: Cuesto è devuto a lo facto que los desveloppatores de lo interlingua voléva mantenere una clara relatione morphològica entre los substantivos e lor adjectivos correspondentes, como "temporal" e "cordial".
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide continues. Red arrows point from "Tempore" to "Temporal" and from "Corde" to "Cordial", illustrating the noun-adjective morphological link maintained in Interlingua

scenes.audio: E algunas paràulas descartan las evolutiones romànicas, como la inclusione de "ove" in vèce de las variationes "ovecla" o "ovellîa" in neolatino.
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide on light grey background. Left: Latin "ovis" -> Interlingua "ove" (highlighted red). Picture of a sheep. Romance/English equivalents ("ovelha", "oveja", "ovella", "sheep"). Right: Latin "ovis + cula = ovicula" -> Neolatino "ovecla / ovellîa" (highlighted red). Romance/English equivalents ("mouton", "pecora", "oiae")

scenes.audio: Un caso semelante con "aure" in vèce de "aurecla" o "aurellîa".
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide on light grey background. Left: Latin "auris" -> Interlingua "aure" (highlighted red). Picture of an ear. Romance/English equivalents ("orelha", "oreja", "orella", "ear"). Right: Latin "auris + cula = auricula" -> Neolatino "aurecla / aurellîa" (highlighted red). Romance/English equivalents ("oreille", "orecchio", "ureche")

scenes.audio: Dicto cuesto, lo interlingua sì contene cognatos tambène con un aspecto romànico principalmente gràtias a lo trabàllio de lo doctore Stanley Mulaik.
scenes.visuals: Screenshot of the first page of the "Interlingua English Dictionary revised by Stan Mulaik" document, hosted online. The text discusses revisions made to the original dictionary

scenes.audio: Plus sopre cuesto plus tarde...
scenes.visuals: Black screen with centered white text: "Plus sopre cuesto plus tarde... x2"

scenes.audio: Meo ponto principale por acora è que, in lo contexto de las lenguas romànicas, cuestas paràulas non engloban completamente los aspectos, las evolutiones phonèticas o las variationes que se tropan in las lenguas romànicas.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks against the green screen, summarizing that Interlingua words don't fully capture Romance nuances

scenes.audio: LA GRAMMÀTICA
scenes.visuals: Dark purple background with centered white text "LA GRAMMÀTICA" above an icon of a document with "S+V" and a magnifying glass over it

scenes.audio: La grammàtica?
scenes.visuals: Animation on a light grey background. The Interlingua flag appears on the left, a large ≠ symbol in the middle, and flags of Romance languages (Portuguese, Spanish, Romanian, French, Italian, Romanian) on the right. Above, the text "La grammàtica?"

scenes.audio: La grammàtica de lo interlingua è molto differente de quella de las lenguas romànicas in octo modos fundamentales.
scenes.visuals: Bright yellow background with centered black text: "8 (ÒCTO) MÒDOS FUNDAMENTALES"

scenes.audio: 1. LO GÈNERE
scenes.visuals: Bright yellow background with centered black text: "1. LO GÈNERE"

scenes.audio: A lo interlingua le manca lo gènere grammaticale devuto a la influèntia de lo anglese.
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide on light beige background. Title "1. LO GÈNERE". Left column titled "INTERLINGUA" with examples "Le matre e le patre." and "Un libro e un porta." Right column titled "NEOLATINO" is initially empty. Bottom box shows UK flag and English translation "The mother and the father. A book and a door." Audio explains Interlingua lacks grammatical gender

scenes.audio: In interlingua, "le matre" e "le patre", "un libro" e "un porta". Ma in neolatino, "la matre" e "lo patre", "un libro" e "una pòrta".
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide continues. Neolatino examples appear: "La matre et lo patre." and "Un libro et una pòrta." Key articles ("Le", "Un", "La", "lo", "una") are highlighted red to show gender agreement/lack thereof

scenes.audio: 2. LA CONCORDANTIA GRAMMATICALE
scenes.visuals: Bright yellow background with centered black text: "2. LA CONCORDANTIA GRAMMATICALE"

scenes.audio: Plo neolatino ancora a la concordantia grammaticale.
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide on light beige background. Title "2. LA CONCORDANTIA GRAMMATICALE". Left column titled "INTERLINGUA" with example "Le libros es verde." Right column titled "NEOLATINO" is initially empty. Bottom box shows UK flag and English translation "The books are green." Audio states Neolatino has grammatical concordance

scenes.audio: In interlingua, "le libros es verde", ma in neolatino, "los libros son verdes". Perque è plurale lo substantivo, tanto lo artìculo quanto lo adjectivo necessitan èssere plurales.
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide continues. Neolatino example appears: "Los libros son verdes." Key words ("Le", "es", "Los", "libros", "son", "verdes") and the plural endings (-s) are highlighted red. An arrow points from "libros" to the label "PLURALE"

scenes.audio: 3. CONJUGATIONES VERBALES
scenes.visuals: Bright yellow background with centered black text: "3. CONJUGATIONES VERBALES"

scenes.audio: Lo neolatino ancora a conjugationes verbales ùnicas, mentre que lo interlingua las exclude.
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide on light beige background. Title "3. CONJUGATIONES VERBALES". Left column titled "INTERLINGUA" lists verb forms (all "canta"). Right column titled "NEOLATINO" is initially empty. Bottom box shows UK flag and English translations. Audio explains Neolatino has unique conjugations while Interlingua excludes them

scenes.audio: Per exèmplo, in interlingua, "io canta", "tu canta", "ille canta", "vos canta", "illes canta", "nos canta". Ma in neolatino, "èo canto", "tu cantas", "elle canta", "vós cantates", "ellos cantan", "nós cantamos".
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide continues. Neolatino conjugated forms appear: "Èo canto", "Tu cantas", "(Elle / Ella) canta", "Vós cantates", "(Ellos / Ellas) cantan", "Nós cantamos". Key verb forms/endings are highlighted red

scenes.audio: Cuesto nos porta logicamente a la sequente differèntia.
scenes.visuals: The man resumes speaking in front of the green screen, transitioning to the next point

scenes.audio: 4. LA ELIMINATIONE DE PRONOMES PERSONALES
scenes.visuals: Bright yellow background with centered black text: "4. LA ELIMINATIONE DE PRONOMES PERSONALES"

scenes.audio: In interlingua, è obligatòrio lo pronòme personale ante la forma conjugata de lo verbo perque, cene ello, sería poco claro lo subjecto de la frase.
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide on light beige background. Title "4. PRONOMES PERSONALES". Left column (INTERLINGUA) shows "Io mangia le pomo." with "Io" highlighted red and an arrow pointing to "Obligatòrio!". It also shows "X Mangia le pomo." Right column (NEOLATINO) is empty. Bottom box shows UK flag and translation "I eat the apple." Audio explains the pronoun is mandatory in Interlingua

scenes.audio: In neolatino, como in la majorìa de las lenguas romànicas, se pote exclùdere lo pronòme, perque lo verbo conjugato ja communica lo subjecto.
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide continues. Neolatino examples appear: "✓ Èo mangîo lo pomo." and "✓ Mangîo lo pomo.", demonstrating the pronoun is optional

scenes.audio: 5. LA EXPRESSIONE DE LO PASSATO
scenes.visuals: Bright yellow background with centered black text: "5. LA EXPRESSIONE DE LO PASSATO"

scenes.audio: In interlingua, in oppositione a lo neolatino, existe un solo tèmpo verbale sìmplice que parla sobre lo passato.
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide on light beige background. Title "5. LO PASSATO". Left column (INTERLINGUA) titled "Preterito sìmplice:" with description "Actiones definitos et actiones indefinitos". Right column (NEOLATINO) is empty. Audio explains Interlingua has one simple past tense

scenes.audio: Ma lo neolatino a lo preterito perfecto sìmplice, por actiones con un fine definito, e lo preterito imperfecto por actiones con un fine indefinito.
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide continues. Neolatino column now has two sections: "Preterito perfecto sìmplice: Actiones definitos" (definitos highlighted) and "Preterito imperfecto: Actiones indefinitos" (indefinitos highlighted)

scenes.audio: Per exèmplo, in interlingua: "Io caminava quando io audiva un sono." Ma in neolatino: "Estava caminando quando odíi un suòno."
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide continues. Interlingua example: "Io caminava quando io audiva un sono." Neolatino example: "(Èo) estava caminando [Imperfecto bracket] quando (èo) audíi [Sìmplice bracket] un sòno." Bottom box shows UK flag and translation "I was walking when I heard a sound."

scenes.audio: 6. LO PRESÈNTE CONTÍNUO
scenes.visuals: Bright yellow background with centered black text: "6. LO PRESÈNTE CONTÍNUO"

scenes.audio: Lo neolatino mantene lo presente contínuo, ma lo interlingua non, devuto a la influèntia de lo francese.
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide on light beige background. Title "6. LO PRESÈNTE CONTÍNUO". Left (INTERLINGUA) shows "Io canta." twice. Right (NEOLATINO) is empty. Bottom box shows UK flag and translations "I sing. / I am singing." Audio explains Neolatino keeps the present continuous, but Interlingua doesn't

scenes.audio: In interlingua, "Io canta". Ma in neolatino, "èo estao cantando".
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide continues. Neolatino example appears: "(Èo) estao cantando." An arrow points from "estao" to a box labeled "'Estare' + Gerundio"

scenes.audio: 7. LO MÒDO SUBJUNCTIVO
scenes.visuals: Bright yellow background with centered black text: "7. LO MÒDO SUBJUNCTIVO"

scenes.audio: Lo modo subjunctivo, lo modo de la irrealitate, està presente in neolatino, ma in interlingua, non.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks against the green screen, explaining the subjunctive mood

scenes.audio: In interlingua: "Il es importante que tu veni." Ma in neolatino: "È importante que vènnîas."
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide on light beige background. Title "7. LO MÒDO SUBJUNCTIVO". Left (INTERLINGUA): "(Il) es importante que tu veni." Right (NEOLATINO): "Èst importante que (tu) vènnîas." with "vènnîas" highlighted red and an arrow pointing to "SUBJUNCTIVO". Bottom box shows UK flag and translation "It is important that you come."

scenes.audio: Observa la paràula "il" ante la paràula "es".
scenes.visuals: The man points out the optional "il" in the Interlingua example on the comparison slide

scenes.audio: Un altro exèmplo: in interlingua, "Si io habeva plus moneta, io serea ric." In neolatino, "Si avesse plus denario, sería ricco."
scenes.visuals: Another comparison slide for Subjunctive Mood. Left (INTERLINGUA): "Si io habeva [Preterito sìmplice bracket] plus moneta, io serea ric." Right (NEOLATINO): "Si (èo) havesse [Subjunctivo de lo imperfecto bracket] plus denario, (èo) sería ricco." Bottom box shows UK flag and translation "If I had more money, I would be rich."

scenes.audio: 8. PRONOMES IMPERSONALES
scenes.visuals: Bright yellow background with centered black text: "8. PRONOMES IMPERSONALES"

scenes.audio: Lo interlingua a dos pronòmes impersonales. Lo primo è "il", que se usa optionalmente quando lo subjecto è abstracto o se revela plus tarde in la frase.
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide on light beige background. Title "8. PRONOMES IMPERSONALES". Left (INTERLINGUA) shows "(Il) es ver que io es alte." Right (NEOLATINO) is empty. Bottom box shows UK flag and translation "It is true that I am tall." Audio explains the impersonal pronoun "il" in Interlingua

scenes.audio: Per exèmplo: "Il es ver que io es alte". Altro exèmplo è: "Il face frìgido", o, simplemente: "Face frìgido".
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide continues. Second Interlingua example appears: "(Il) face frigido." Bottom box adds the translation "It is cold."

scenes.audio: Ma in neolatino, como in la majorìa de las lenguas romànicas, non existe tala pronòme.
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide continues. Neolatino column remains empty as the audio explains this pronoun doesn't exist in Neolatino

scenes.audio: Pertanto, las traductiones neolatinas serían: "Èst vèro que so alto." "Face frégedo".
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide continues. Neolatino translations appear: "Èst vèro que (èo) so alto." and "Face frégedo."

scenes.audio: Lo secundo pronòme è "on", que se usa quando la identitate de lo subjecto è vaga.
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide adds a new Interlingua example: "On crede lo que on spera." Right column (NEOLATINO) is still empty. Bottom box adds translation "One believes what one hopes for." Audio explains the second impersonal pronoun "on"

scenes.audio: Per exèmplo: "On crede lo que on spera". In neolatino, como in moltas lenguas romànicas, cuesto corresponde a lo uso de la voce passiva, specificamente con "se".
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide continues. Neolatino column remains empty. Audio explains that in Neolatino, this corresponds to the passive voice with "se"

scenes.audio: Per exèmplo: "Se crede lo que se espera".
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide continues. Neolatino example appears: "Se crede lo que se espera." Bottom box adds translation "/ It is believed what is hoped for."

scenes.audio: Lo ponto a qui è que cuestos pronòmes son ùnicos a lo interlingua.
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide showing Interlingua impersonal pronouns "Il" and "On". Red X marks appear next to flags of Romance languages (except French, which gets a green checkmark for "Il"), indicating these pronouns are generally not found in Romance

scenes.audio: Apare que furon presos directamente de lo francese, ma pronòmes semelantes existen in lenguas germànicas como lo anglese e lo alemanno.
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide continues. Below the Interlingua section, it shows equivalents in French ("Il / Ce", "On"), English ("It", "One"), and German ("Es", "Man"), indicating similar pronouns exist in Germanic languages

scenes.audio: Cuestos pronòmes non representan las lenguas romànicas in generale. Son provas de la natura europea de lo interlingua.
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide remains, emphasizing that Interlingua's impersonal pronouns reflect its broader European basis, not just Romance

scenes.audio: LA CONFUSIONE
scenes.visuals: Dark red background with centered white text "LA CONFUSIONE" above a light blue stick figure icon shrugging with question marks around its head

scenes.audio: Malgrado cuestas aparentes differèntias entre lo interlingua e lo neolatino, la confusione persiste.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks against the green screen, stating that confusion between the two languages persists despite differences

scenes.audio: La ratsone plus òbvia por cuesto è que simplemente las personas non conocen lo neolatino.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking, suggesting the most obvious reason for confusion is lack of awareness about Neolatino

scenes.audio: Ma ìa altras ratsiones por la persistente confusione.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks, mentioning other reasons for the confusion

scenes.audio: Algunas personas simplemente non comprenden lo objectivo de lo interlingua.
scenes.visuals: The man continues, stating some people don't understand Interlingua's objective

scenes.audio: Observan los aspectos superficiales de lo interlingua e saltan a la conclusione: "Eh, pare romànico! Per que non lo usamos por unire los parlantes de lenguas romànicas?"
scenes.visuals: The man speaks, describing how people might superficially see Interlingua as Romance and jump to the conclusion it should be used to unite Romance speakers

scenes.audio: E non culpo cuestas personas, perque pensava lo mesmo!
scenes.visuals: The man speaks against the green screen, admitting he used to think the same way

scenes.audio: De facto, ante de descovrire lo neolatino, estava aprendendo interlingua, perque pensai que era essentialmente una lengua panromànica.
scenes.visuals: The man continues, explaining he learned Interlingua initially, mistakenly believing it was pan-Romance

scenes.audio: Algunas personas conocen lo orìgine e la intentione de lo interlingua, ma contìnuan ad atràgere personas atravèrso de lo que clamo "mejjas veritates".
scenes.visuals: The man speaks, accusing some people of knowingly attracting others to Interlingua using half-truths

scenes.audio: Allora, si la gente a ja un preconcepto sobre lo interlingua a causa de so aspecto, e pos los promotores omiten intentionalmente informationes importantes, pos, logicamente, cuestas personas manteneràn la idea que lo interlingua sea una solutione romànica.
scenes.visuals: Animated graphic on a grey background illustrates the confusion process. Left: Thinking emoji with thought bubble "Las paraulas paren romànicas...". Middle: Plus sign, then a photo of a smiling Black man giving two thumbs up, with a thought bubble "Lo interlingua èst completamente romànico, fra." Above him, text items like "Particularitates de la grammàtica", "Influèntias latinas VS Influèntias romànicas", "Lo objectivo originale" are crossed out in red. Right: Equals sign, then a large yellow smiley face with thought bubble "Lo interlingua èst romànico!"

scenes.audio: A qui estan algunas provas. Cuestos commentarios in YouTube describen lo interlingua como romànico o plus apto por parlantes de lenguas romànicas.
scenes.visuals: Screenshot montage of YouTube comments. Various comments are highlighted in blue, seemingly describing Interlingua as Romance or suitable for Romance speakers

scenes.audio: Cuesto vìdeo de lo canale InfoPrimates afirma que lo interlingua è simplemente una mescla de lenguas romànicas.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks against the green screen, referencing a video by InfoPrimates

scenes.audio: Pero me preguntaba, ¿qué ocurriría si alguien mezcla todos estos idiomas y crea un nuevo idioma de este? En cierto modo, a medio camino entre todos los idiomas romances. Pero estás describiendo Interlingua. ¿Qué macacos es Interlingua? Jamás lo había oído mentar. Es exactamente lo que acabas de describir.
scenes.visuals: Short, edited clip from an animated video (likely InfoPrimates). Flags of Romance languages merge into an abstract flag. A cartoon character asks about mixing Romance languages, and another character identifies the result as Interlingua. Text "*Editato per brevitate" appears

scenes.audio: Un vìdeo de lo canale Ecolinguist retracta lo interlingua como romànico con lo tìtulo, ponendo la demanda: "Unirà las lenguas romànicas?"
scenes.visuals: Screenshot of a YouTube video page by Ecolinguist titled "The Interlingua Experiment: Will it connect the Romance languages?". The video thumbnail shows four people in a video call

scenes.audio: De plus, la descriptione dice tambène: "...fu creato por èssere comprendudo per parlantes de lenguas romànicas."
scenes.visuals: Screenshot focuses on the video description text below the Ecolinguist video. The phrase "created to be understood by people who speak Romance languages" is highlighted in blue

scenes.audio: La disinformatione è tanto periculosa que pote terminare in una pàgina governamentale, como se vede in questa pàgina legata a lo governo canadiano.
scenes.visuals: Screenshot of a webpage from the Government of Canada website (Canada.ca) titled "Interlingua: An international language". The phrase "Interlingua is a synthesis of Latin-based languages." is highlighted in blue

scenes.audio: È molto estrànio vedére totas cuestas informationes contradictòrias. A vèces algunas fontes mencionan la influèntia de lo anglese e altras lenguas, e altras non.
scenes.visuals: Comparison graphic on a light beige background. Left side: Red X, text "NON se mentionan lenguas non romànicas!", screenshots of sources seemingly omitting non-Romance influence. Right side: Green checkmark, text "SÍ se mentionan lenguas non romànicas!", screenshots of sources mentioning non-Romance influence

scenes.audio: PER QUE ÈST CUESTO MALO?
scenes.visuals: Dark grey background with centered white text "PER QUE ÈST CUESTO MALO?" above a thinking emoji with a hand on its chin

scenes.audio: Okay, allora, per que è malo cuesto?
scenes.visuals: The man speaks against the green screen, asking why this misinformation is bad

scenes.audio: La diffusione defectuosa de informationes sobre lo interlingua presenta una crise de identitate confusa con varias consequèntias. A sapére: è romànico o non?
scenes.visuals: Screenshot of an archived webpage (page30.com) discussing Interlingua. A large section of text is highlighted in blue, discussing the scientific approach, difficulties for Romance speakers, Germanic tenses, and the consequence of needing constant explanation

scenes.audio: Lo mètodo scientifico de lo interlingua lo rènde diffìcile de acceptare. Los parlantes de lenguas romànicas pènsan que lo interlingua deverìa èssere plus semelante ad lo italiano, lo espannîòlo aut lo portughese! Et un argumènto comune contra la lengua èst que los tèmpos verbales son generalmente germànicos et non sequen la pràctica de las lenguas romànicas. La consequèntia de cuesto èst que con cata nòvo usuario, èst necessario explicare repetitamente per que una data paràula pare una cèrta manaria et non la altra. Et finalmente, te ennoias ad mòrte explicando toto in vece de usare la lengua por la communicatione."
scenes.visuals: Text quote from the previous webpage screenshot is shown large on a light grey background, with key phrases highlighted in yellow. The quote discusses the difficulty Romance speakers have with Interlingua due to its scientific method and Germanic-like tenses, leading to constant explanation instead of communication. The source is cited as "-Kjell, groups.yahoo.com/group/occidental"

scenes.audio: È possibile che la gente aprenda interlingua por la ratsone errata. Dunque, algunas personas se poterìan sentire traditas, sentèndo se como si avéssen perduto lor tèmpo.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks against the green screen, suggesting people might learn Interlingua for the wrong reasons and feel betrayed

scenes.audio: Cuestas personas poten denigrare lo interlingua e dìcere que manca una ànima, perque an una preconceptione errata de la lengua. Las personas conscientemente proban de cambiare lo interlingua ad una lengua romànica, perque veden la forma bàsica de la lengua como defectuosa.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking, explaining how this misconception might lead people to denigrate Interlingua or try to change it into a Romance language

scenes.audio: Questa idea a portato a diversas propostas romànicas.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks, mentioning this idea has led to various Romance proposals

scenes.audio: In resposta a la quantitate limitata de paràulas grammaticales, lo doctore Stanley Mulaik proponeu una grande quantitate de paràulas romànicas in lo interlingua.
scenes.visuals: Scrolling view of pages from Stanley Mulaik's revised Interlingua dictionary PDF, showing extensive word lists

scenes.audio: Okay, a lo inìtio, non ìa ne quasi de malo in quello.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks against the green screen, initially seeing no harm in Mulaik's additions

scenes.audio: Ma claramente proponeu tambène versiones romànicas de paràulas ja existentes.
scenes.visuals: Grey table comparing original Interlingua words (Dum, Hic, Nunquam, etc.) with Mulaik's proposed new Romance versions (Mentre, Aqui, Nunca, etc.) and English translations

scenes.audio: Non se tracta de un sìmplice caso de ampliare lo vocabulario, ma de un effortio consciente por transformare lo caràctere de la lengua.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks, arguing Mulaik's changes were a conscious effort to transform the language's character, not just expand vocabulary

scenes.audio: Oltra cuesto, lo projecto Interlingua Romanica nasceo de lo desìdero de dare a lo Interlingua una grammàtica traditionalmente romànica.
scenes.visuals: Screenshot of an archived Geocities webpage for "ROMANICA", subtitled "Pro la union de las linguas latinas". Text discusses creating a neutral auxiliary language based on Latin

scenes.audio: Ìa duas escolas de pensamento entre los usuarios de lo interlingua. Un gruppo crede que la lengua deverìa èssere plus romànica e lo altro gruppo crede que rèndere lo interlingua plus romànico va contra lo spìrito de la lengua.
scenes.visuals: Comparison graphic on light grey background. Left column: Title "Gruppo 1", text "Plus romànico = BÒNO!", smiling emoji with star eyes. Right column: Title "Gruppo 2", text "Plus romànico = MALO!", emoji face with a scarf/mask. Audio describes the two schools of thought among Interlingua users

scenes.audio: Lo problèma de cuestas propostas è que, oltra lo facto que non son universalmente acceptatas, se basan sobre una falsa impressione de la lengua.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks against the green screen, stating the problem with these proposals is they are based on a false impression of Interlingua

scenes.audio: Cuestas propostas se distàntian de lo objectivo originale de la lengua, ma a lo mesmo tèmpo, devuto a los componentes bàsicos de la lengua, non van sufficientemente longe por èssere romànicas.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking, arguing these proposals deviate from Interlingua's original goal but don't go far enough to be truly Romance

scenes.audio: In contrasto, la beltate de lo neolatino è que è fundamentalmente romànico. Non son necessàrias las propostas de reforma, perque lo neolatino non intente èssere plus que una ferramenta por unire las lenguas romànicas.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks, contrasting the proposals with Neolatino, which he describes as fundamentally Romance and not needing reforms

scenes.audio: Oltra cuesto, lo objectivo claro evita ambiguitate in tèrminos de so identitate e potentiales scismas entre sos usuarios.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking, stating Neolatino's clear objective avoids ambiguity and potential schisms

scenes.audio: De plus, lo neolatino a una ànima. Amei a ànima. A la ànima de los altros usuarios. E sobretoto, a la ànima de las lenguas romànicas.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks passionately, stating Neolatino has a soul connected to Romance languages

scenes.audio: De facto, cueste mesmo vìdeo a una prova. Ao parlato in neolatino toto cueste tèmpo. È complexo e ricco como toa lengua matre, e de acòrdo con los principios de la lengua, in un cèrto senso, è plus un dialecto de la pròpria lengua romànica nativa in vèce de èssere una lengua artificiale.
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking, revealing he has been speaking Neolatino the entire time, calling it complex, rich, and fundamentally Romance

scenes.audio: Ad qui importa?
scenes.visuals: Light beige background with centered black text "AD QUI IMPORTA?" above a frowning yellow emoji face

scenes.audio: Forse stedes pensando: Okay, incluso si lo interlingua non è panromànico, quale è lo problèma? O sea, non lo pote usare simplemente como una lengua panromànica igualmente?
scenes.visuals: The man speaks against the green screen, anticipating the viewer's question about whether Interlingua can just be used as pan-Romance anyway

scenes.audio: Bene, lo explicarae assì:
scenes.visuals: The man prepares to explain his point of view

scenes.audio: Lo facto que qualcosa pòssa tecnicamente complire un fine non vole dìcere que sea la solutione ideale.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks, making the point that technical possibility doesn't equal the ideal solution

scenes.audio: Per exèmplo, preferirìas tallare la erba con lo uso de forfeces o una talliaerba?
scenes.visuals: Animated graphic on light grey background. Left: Neutral emoji face, picture of tall grass. Middle: Image of scissors appears above the grass, emoji turns sad. Right: Scissors are crossed out with a red X, image of a lawnmower appears, emoji turns happy

scenes.audio: Oltra lo facto que clamare lo interlingua romànico è incorrecto por las ratsiones que ja ao enumerato, diría que è una injustìtia a la hereditate de las lenguas romànicas non devotare se plenamente a lo que las rende ùnicas.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks against the green screen, reiterating that calling Interlingua Romance is incorrect and an injustice to the uniqueness of Romance languages

scenes.audio: Podes comunicare lo significato, ma podes comunicare la història?
scenes.visuals: The man continues speaking, asking rhetorically if one can communicate history (implying cultural depth) with Interlingua as easily as meaning

scenes.audio: Ìa tantas cosas ùnicas aprèndere e in conto, dependendo de la lengua: las positiones de los advèrbios, las omisiones o las inclusiones de los artìculos, los usos de lo modo subjunctivo, e assì sucessivamente.
scenes.visuals: Comparison graphics briefly flash showing different structures in Neolatino vs Romance for adverb placement ("Ja lo hai facto."), article use ("Hai cane."), and subjunctive use ("Suppono que has rattsone.")

scenes.audio: Lo interlingua simplemente non tene conto de las incontàbiles characterìsticas de las lenguas romànicas perque, por comensare, nunca fu romànico!
scenes.visuals: Green background with large white text "NUNCA FU" (underlined red) above "ROMÀNICO". Below is the Interlingua flag

scenes.audio: Desde lo inìtio, lo neolatino fu sempre conceputo como romànico. Non pretende èssere ùtile por altros objectivos. Si voles una lengua panromànica, o la versione romànica de lo interslavo, aprende neolatino.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks against the green screen, emphasizing Neolatino was always conceived as Romance and recommending it for those seeking a pan-Romance language

scenes.audio: Por èssere claro, non òdio lo interlingua. Me place lo interlingua! Incluso ao facto un vìdeo mostrando recursos por aprèndele lo.
scenes.visuals: Screenshot of the speaker's YouTube channel page ("Arrunzo"), showing thumbnails of videos, including one titled "Recursos to Learn Interlingua" and another "Recursos para aprender Interlingua"

scenes.audio: De facto, algunos de cuestos recursos ao usato ante de aprèndere neolatino.
scenes.visuals: Screenshot zooms in on the "Recursos para aprender Interlingua" video, showing a GitHub link (github.com/arrunzo/interlingua-es) for resources

scenes.audio: Lo que non me place è la disinformatione. Acora plus que jemaes in la era digitale, quando cìrcolan informationes erratas, las cosas exen de contròllo rapidamente.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks against the green screen, stating he dislikes misinformation, especially in the digital age

scenes.audio: Mira: lo interlingua e lo neolatino son simplemente dos projectos distinctos con objectivos differentes.
scenes.visuals: Comparison slide on light grey background summarizing Interlingua and Romance Neolatino (Neolatino). Interlingua Objective: For speakers of European languages. Vocabulary: Mainly Romance, many Latin words. Grammar: European. Neolatino Objective: Only for speakers of Romance languages! Vocabulary: Romance. Grammar: Romance

scenes.audio: Non è necessario aprèndere neolatino, ma fachas lo que fachas, asegùra te de avére todos los factos. Ma si lo neolatino te interessa, ìa moltas manàrias por participare a la communitate: dos gruppos de Facebook, Telegram, Discord, Reddit e àltros. Todos los legàmines por unire te sobre lo sito officiale: neolatino.eu.
scenes.visuals: Montage of screenshots showing Neolatino community platforms: Facebook page ("Neolatino"), Facebook group ("ESCÒLA NEOLATINA"), Telegram chat, Discord server ("Neolatino"), Reddit page ("r/neolatino"), and the official website address neolatino.eu highlighted at the bottom

scenes.audio: De plus, un dictionario in lìnea, un dictionario PDF, un conjugatore, un documento de grammàtica e dos teclatos electrònicos. E cuesto cene mentionare àltros materiales in corso, como listas de vocabulario e lectiones.
scenes.visuals: Montage of screenshots showing Neolatino learning resources: online dictionary (neolatino.github.io/dictionario), PDF dictionary cover ("DICTIONARIO ESSENTIALE NEOLATINO"), online tools page including conjugator (neolatino.eu/ferramentas.html), grammar document PDF, Android keyboard selection screen showing "Latinan", LibreOffice document showing Neolatino text and language set to "Latin", vocabulary spreadsheet, and lesson document

scenes.audio: La communitate neolatina cresce cada día e nos placería molto avére te. Gràtias por la attentione.
scenes.visuals: The man speaks against the green screen, inviting viewers to the growing Neolatino community and thanking them

Final screen on a dark red background. Text reads "Visita-nos en neolatino.eu". Below are logos and handles for Neolatino social media: Telegram (Escòla Neolatina), Discord (Neolatino), Facebook (@vianeolatina), Facebook group (Escòla Neolatina), Reddit (r/neolatino), Twitter (@ViaNeolatina), Instagram (vianeolatina)
